Title: How to Participate in the SYB Network: Stake, Vouch, and Build On‑Chain Reputation
Author: Aamir Muhammad
Description: A step‑by‑step guide to staking TON, vouching on Sepolia, and building your SYB reputation for governance.
CoverImageAlt: Visual guide showing the steps to stake TON tokens and participate in SYB Network governance

Title: Introducing Tokamak zk-SNARK: Cryptography Made Practical
Author: Nil Soroush
Description: How Tokamak’s universal-setup zkSNARK and modular zkEVM deliver smaller proofs, cheaper verification, and flexible deployment.

Title: Tokamak Network ZKP: Zero‑Knowledge Proofs, Stupidly Simple
Description: Announcing Tokamak Network’s one‑click ZKP generation — turn complex cryptography into a developer‑first workflow.

Title: Delegating Computations of Multi-Scalar Multiplication
Author: Luca Dall’Ava
Description: The aim of this technical blog post is to review various attempts and solutions to remove a very challenging cryptographic bottleneck, crucial to most web3 applications, namely, the possibility to delegate computation (of MSMs) to an untrusted party. The scenario considered is that of an on-chain verifier trying to delegate the computation of an MSM.

Title: Building Trust Without Surveillance
Author: Nil Soroush
Description: Defines SYB’s privacy model and sets the constraints needed to protect the trust graph on a public ledger.

Title: The Cryptographic Magic Nobody Told You About
Author: Aamir
Description: A plain-language intro to FROST threshold signatures, DKG, and why an invisible single address can be controlled by many.

Title: Multi-Sig vs Threshold Signatures: Which one to chose?
Author: Aamir
Description: A practical framework for choosing between multi-sig and threshold signatures across transparency, privacy, and cost.

Title: Scaling Tokamak: Efficient Batched Verification for Tokamak zk-SNARKs
Author: Luca Dall’Ava
Description: Discover how batched verification reduces on-chain costs for Tokamak zk-SNARKs by replacing expensive sequential pairing operations with efficient aggregated checks, enabling high-throughput scalability.

Title: Ghost Vouching: Inside SYB’s Privacy Protocol
Author: Nil Soroush

Title: The algorithm behind the SYB Network (MVP version)
Author: Luca Dall'Ava
Description: We describe here the algorithm behind the reputation score in the SYB Network (MVP version) and present a few simple examples of a small network.
CoverImageAlt: Diagram illustrating the SYB Network reputation algorithm with nodes and vouching relationships

Title: The SYB Network (MVP version) Notebook
Author: Luca Dall'Ava
Description: We present here the SYB Network (MVP version) Notebook. This is an interactive tool for simulating the SYB Network behavior as well as Sybil attacks.

Title: Pick, Wire & Prove; The Anatomy of Tokamak zk-SNARK
Author: Nil Soroush
Description: We present a high-level overview of Tokamak zk-SNARK.

Title: On-chain privacy trilemma: Why True Privacy Is Still Hard on Ethereum
Author: Mehdi
Description: How the pursuit of privacy collides with usability and security — and how new protocols like Tokamak Channels might resolve it.

Title: Zero-Knowledge Proofs, Simply Explained by Tokamak
Author: Aamir Muhammad
Description: A friendly, plain-language intro to zero-knowledge proofs with everyday examples and why they matter.

Title: Sybil attacks: what are they and why should you care?
Author: Luca Dall'Ava & Jamie Judd
Description: We discuss here the notion of a Sybil attack and explain why systems should be sybil-resistant through some examples.
CoverImageAlt: Illustration depicting the concept of Sybil attacks in distributed networks

Title: Tokamak Private App Channels: A Comparative Analysis
Author: Nil Soroush,  Jake Jang
Description: A technical  comparison of Tokamak Private App Channels against Aztec, Aleo, Penumbra, and COTI V2.
